segments.text: Paul , you were also a parent of young kids before . So , can you tell me what you did when your kids didn ’ t behave very well ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I know Mark is your only child . You may do it differently from what I did . Sometimes I would tap their hands when they made troubles .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I do it , too . You know , sometimes when we eat , my child would pull a dish towards him and grab it with his hands and eat . And if it were something he doesn ’ t like , he would spit it out and throw it into other dishes . He does it very often . I really get mad . I can ’ t help spank him sometimes .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: And what does your husband do ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: My husband is an American . He criticizes me when I do that . He says that I can ’ t change a child ’ s behavior by using force . He is learning what I am doing now .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: But spoiling a child is not going to do him good either ! You ’ Ve got to have patience with him and teach him . It ’ s not easy , I know . It ’ s hard .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yeah . I ’ m still learning how to control his behavior and my temper . My child is almost two years old , and I ’ Ve learnt the distraction technique when he cries for something .
segments.speaker: S1
